title: Ticket Lifecycle: From Customer Submission to Satisfaction Rating
subtitle: Follow this guide to experience the complete ticket process from creation, communication, processing to final rating, playing both customer and support roles.

mainSteps.title: Support Perspective: Respond and Process Tickets
Closure: Customer Rating and Process Completion

steps.title: Experience the Complete Ticket Interaction Process
steps.description: Now, let's begin a standard ticket service process and experience seamless collaboration between customers and support staff.

button.label: Create Customer Service Account to Experience Complete Ticket Interaction

steps.title: Step 1: Customer Perspective: Submit Service Request
steps.description: First, we act as administrators to create a login account for customers to access the service portal, then switch to the customer perspective for operation.

steps.title: Backend: Create Login Account for Customer
steps.description: The first step of the process, as an administrator or support agent, we create a user account for the customer to log into the service portal from existing 'Contact' information.

button.label: Backend: Create Login Account for Customer

steps.title: Customer: Login to Service Portal
steps.description: Now, we switch to the customer perspective and log into the dedicated customer service portal using the account information just created.

steps.title: Customer: Create New Service Request
steps.description: After logging in, customers can clearly see the 'Create Ticket' entry on the portal homepage, making it easy to submit problems or requests at any time.

steps.title: Customer: Fill in Ticket Details
steps.description: Customers follow the guidance to fill in problem title, description, priority and other detailed information, then submit the ticket.

steps.title: Customer: View Submitted Ticket and Add Information
steps.description: After submission, customers can enter the ticket details page at any time to check processing status and add more information or screenshots through the comment function.

button.label: Customer: View Submitted Ticket and Add Information

steps.title: Step 2: Support Perspective: Respond and Process Tickets
steps.description: The customer has submitted the problem, now let's switch to the support workstation to see how to respond and process.

steps.title: Support: View Pending Ticket List
steps.description: Switching perspective again. Support staff will immediately see the new ticket submitted by the customer on their workstation and understand its basic situation.

steps.title: Support: Reply to Customer for Communication
steps.description: Support staff enters the ticket details and interacts with customers through comments, which can be reassurance, requesting details, or informing progress. All communication records are preserved.

button.label: Support: Reply to Customer for Communication

steps.title: Support: Process Ticket (Assign, Resolve)
steps.description: In addition to direct communication, support staff can also perform more operations as needed, such as assigning the problem to more suitable experts, or marking it as 'Completed' after the problem is resolved.

steps.title: Step 3: Customer Rating and Process Completion
steps.description: The ticket processing is complete, the last step is to get customer feedback and complete the entire service process loop.

steps.title: Customer: Rate the Service
steps.description: When support staff resolves the problem and closes the ticket, customers will receive notifications and can rate the service satisfaction, forming a complete service loop.
